name: Best Offense is a good Defense, or is it the opposite?
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: As per topic tittle, what matters more for you and your playstyle? Have a 40 AB 700 hp's DR 21/ - front line warrior, eating up all the heat of battle and still standing at the end of the day OR do you prefer an unparallel offense - a rampaging 50 AB weapon master with a greataxe, that kills before he is killed? I am interested in your personal preferences and not if the one or the other is better ;)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: I enjoy playing the heavy hitter - live and die by the sword so to speak.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
I have had fun with both. I just got my rogue 10 / fighter 4 / DD 26 to level 40 on WoG and had a great time with him. With 22 CON and EDR III, he was pretty hard to hurt at the end there. Of course, he wasn't purely defensive (not a dexer) and, as part of a duo team, he could rely on BlackCobra's cleric for great buffs and added offensive power when needed. And that toon was not purely a power build since WoG isn't an arena or level 40 PvE server and there is little point to builds that sacrifice effectiveness during 90% of the build's playable life in order to get better goodies at the tail end.

At the same time, my gf (who doesn't get a chance to play much but duos with me along as arcane backup) was saying that it was almost too easy to play one of my WM (scythe-wielding strengther) builds. By the early epics, most bosses were going down in two or three rounds. But, our tactics were different there, since wading into a group of hard-hitting baddies wasn't going to turn out as well.

Overall, it depends much on the environment and on whether the toon is for soloing or for party play. The other factor is the particular opponents I am fighting. Can they be singulated? Are they too tough to take down in a hurry? A 700 hp spell-immune golem with 40/+7 DR isn't going down quickly in my +5 weapon environment, so I had better have a solid AC or be able to take some damage. I am a cautious soloist, so I tend to go defensive on those builds.

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
MrZork wrote:

Excellent point here.....
I myself am all roleplay so for me it would depend on how each character is seen in my mind's eye... is he a rugged ole dwarven fighter well he'll probably be able to take quite a lickin... the crafty gnome he'd probably be smarter and harder to hit..the ancient elf who has had a long lifetime to perfect killing blows.. the haughty prince or lowly peasant might both end up living life piously (pal and or Mon) so could go either way.

All in all It depends on the character it's environment and how the character will be played.
At least that's my opinion.

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content: WM, 50+ AB, Dev. Crit., Vorpal weapon and loot my opponent's remains after 3-4 rounds.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Nice topic, val!

I personally prefer the sturdy dwarf. Why? Because they can both achieve the same thing, only difference is how long it takes, but the dwarf will have protection against more things:
- IGMS - more HP means it takes more IGMSs to kill you
- Insta-death spell - Humungous fort save
- sneak-immune - no sneaks on you so with a Ring of Power you take no damage from dexers
- combo with belt - You can equip a belt of DR if your world has them and just be all but immune to one damage type.
- is more effective against crit-immune monsters, which on WoG is a very important thing. :D

Take it EZ!
